snippet: Zaki-ur-Rehman Lakhvi, a militant commander behind the blitz of attacks in India that left 166 people dead, was granted a release on a bond of about $5,000, prompting protests from Indian officials.
abstract: Court in Pakistan grants bail to Zaki-ur-Rehman Lakhvi, accused of orchestrating the 2008 Mumbai terrorist attacks; move draws outcry of protests from India.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Salman Masood reported from Islamabad, and Declan Walsh from London. Gardiner Harris contributed reporting from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: Zaki-ur-Rehman Lakhvi, a militant commander behind the blitz of attacks in India that left 166 people dead, was granted a release on a bond of about $5,000, prompting protests from Indian officials.

headline.main: Key Suspect in 2008 Mumbai Attacks Granted Bail
headline.print_headline: Key Suspect in 2008 Mumbai Attacks Granted Bail
